titles.title: Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary" / Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus "Miracles of Jesus"

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary" (fols. 3ra-6ra, 10ra-109rb) I-1a) Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah (fols. 3ra-6ra) II-a) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus "Miracles of Jesus": 2 miracles (fols. 6ra-9ra) I-1b) Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah (fols. 10ra-15vb) I-2) Introductory exhortation (fols. 16ra-17vb) I-3) ʾƎsäggǝd läki wä-ʾǝweddǝsäki... "I worship Thee…" (fols. 17vb-19ra) I-4a) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary": 46 miracles (fols. 20ra-106vb), incomplete. I-5) ʾAkkonu bǝʾǝsi... "Does not the man..." (distributed among the miracles of Mary, fols. 23rb-77ra), incomplete (33 strophes) I-4b) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary": 1 miracle (fols. 107ra-109rb), fragment II-b) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus "Miracles of Jesus": 1 miracles (fols. 109rb-110vb), fragment
Additiones 1-6.

donors.donor: The names of the original donors have been erased throughout the Ms. According to Additio 5, the Ms. was purchased and donated to the church by Täsfa Maryam. His name and the name of his family members has been added to the supplication formulas in the same hand as Additio 5.

dcomments.dcomment: 18th cent. (?) Quires A-III and B are of more recent time (19th cent.?).

txstates.txstate: The Ms. has been resewn. The leather cover on the back board is cut off. Leaves of quire A and III are damaged at the lower corner (rodents).

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather, textile inlays. Recent overback made of reddish-brown tooled leather (fastened with nails). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover. Due to its poor condition, the tools cannot be identified. Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown overback (2 tools were used: single line fillet, x-form).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

txfolios.txfolio: Foliation mistake: The images after folios 5 and 60 (not foliated), has been given numbers 5a and 60a blank:

squires.squire: {A(2/fols. 1r-2v)} – <I(8/fols. 3r-9v)> – <II(6/fols. 10r-15v)> – <III(4/fols. 16r-19v)> – IV(8/fols. 20r-27v) – ፪V(8/fols. 28r-35v) – ፫VI(8/fols. 36r-43v) – ፬VII(8/fols. 44r-51v) – ፭VIII(8/fols. 52r-59v) – ፮IX(8/fols. 60r-66v) – ፯X(8/fols. 67r-74v) – XI(8/fols. 75r-81v) – XII(8/fol. 82r-90v) – XIII(8/fols. 91r-98v) – XIV(8/fols. 99r-106v) – <XV(4/fols. 107r-110v)> – <B(2; s.l.: 5,6 no stubs/fols. 111r-112v)>

taunit.mr-info: Text area I: fols. 3r-9v (quire I). All data for fol. 4.
taunit.ln-info: the number of lines varies up to 28 (fol. 5a)
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: fols. 3r-9v: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible (partly of slit-type, fol. 3). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Text area II: fols. 10r-15v (quire II). All data are for fol. 11r.
taunit.ln-info: the number of lines varies on other fols.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: fols. 10r-15v: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/A. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Text area III: fols. 16r-19r (quire III). All data are for fol. 18r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: fols. 16r-19v: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Text area IV: fols. 20r-106v (quires IV-XIV). All data are for fol. 22r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: fols. 20r-106v: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Text area V: fols. 107r-110v (quire XV). All data are for fol. 107r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: Fols. 107r-112v: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

ptypeofscripts.ptypeofscript: Hand a, b, c: 19th century. Hand d: 18th century (?). Hand e: 17th century (?).

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: mediocre. Hand b: irregular. Hand c, d, e: fine.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: fols. 3ra-9ra (quire I, Texts I-1a, II-a), rounded script. Hand b: fols. 10ra-15vb (quire II, Text I-1b), irregularly formed, right-sloping letters. Hand c: fols. 16ra-19ra (quire III, Texts I-2, I-3, rounded script. Hand d: fols. 20ra-106vb (quires IV-XIV, Text I-4a), broadly spaced, slight right-sloping letters. Hand e: fols. 107ra-110vb (quire XV, Texts I-4b, II-b), finely shaped, slender letters.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; name of the donors; groups of lines in the incipit page of Text I-4a; incipit of (sub)sections and section numbers of Text I-4a; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ሰላ፡ for ሰላም፡ (fol. 14vab) ለዓ፡ ዓ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (fol. 19rb-vb)

otherdetails.otherdetail: The miracles of Text I-4a are partly numbered (number 27 was given twice).

desccontent.text: I-1) Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah

literature.text: E. CERULLI, Il libro etiopico dei miracoli di Maria e le sue fonti nelle letterature del Medio Evo latino, Roma 1943, 17-22.

desccontent.incipit: Fol. 3ra: በስመ ፡”...  ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ሥርዓት፡ ዘወጽአ፡ እመንበረ፡ ማርቆስ፡ ሐዋርያ፡ እመካነ፡ መዓልቃ፡ ዘምስር፡ ዘአንበሩ፡ መምህራን፡ ክቡራን፡ መጋብያነ፡ ምሥጢር፡ ርቱዓነ፡ ሃይማኖት።...
desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 3ra: In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit, One God. This book of rules that came from the throne of Mark the Apostle, out of the church of Mäˁalqa (al-Muˁallaqah) of Məsr (Cairo) wherein the Orthodox Doctors, treasurers of the mystery had laid it up...
desccontent.etranslation: Fol. 5avb l. 24: ...Salutation to you, Peter and Paul, Jacob and John, and Andrew [Fol. 6ra], Matthew and Philip, and Bartholomew, Thomas and Jacob, the son of Alphaeus, Thaddeus and Nathanael, and Matthias, Luke and Mark, and Jacob the bishop, bless us, your children, by the Holy Spirit.
desccontent.details:
A part of the introductory rite, as it was printed in Täsfa Gäbrä Śəllase 1961:16, is missing in the MS (fol. 4vb). Besides, a part of the introductory exhortation (as printed in Täsfa Gäbrä Śəllase 1961:9-10) was inserted between the two parts of the introductory rite (fol. 5vb, l.17-5αra, l.27). The sälam is present only in the edition Budge 1900:4-5:
Fol. 3ra, l.1-5vb, l.17: Mäṣḥafä śərˁat (1st part)
Fol. 5vb, l.17-5αra, l.27: Haleluya Haleluya nəsgəd läˀabä bərhanat
Fol. 5αra, l.27-5αvb, l.3: Mäṣḥafä śərˁat (2nd part)
Fol. 5αvb, l.4-6ra, l.10: Sälam to the Apostles

desccontent.text: I-1a) Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah
desccontent.mss: Lady Meux 3 (18th cent.), fol. 2r-4v; BritMus Orient. 8814 (18th cent.), fols. 86ra-92v (StrBritLib 46, no. 32).
desccontent.incipit: Fol. 10ra: በስመ ፡”... ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ሥርዓት፡ ዘወጽአ፡ እመንበረ፡ማርቆስ፡ ሐዋርያ፡ እመካነ፡ መዓልቃ፡ ዘምስር፡ ዘአንበሩ፡ መምህራን፡ ሊቀ፡ጳጳሳት፡ ክቡራን፡ መጋብያነ፡ ምሥጢር፡ ርቱዓነ፡ ሃይማኖት። ...
desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 10ra: In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit, One God. This book of rules that came from the throne of Mark the Apostle, out of the church of Mäˁalqa (i.e. Al-Mu´Allaḳah) of Məsr (i.e. Cairo) wherein the Orthodox Doctors, glorious patriarchs, treasurers of the mystery had laid it up...
desccontent.explicit: Fol. 15va l.5: ወለነሂ፡ በሰይፈ፡ ቃልነ፡ ለአባ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ወአባ፡ ገብርኤል፡ውቁያነ፡ ወውጉዛነ፡ ይኩኑ፡ እስመ፡ ንሕነ፡ ነሣእነ፡ ሥልጣነ፡ ዚአሆሙ፡ወበእንተዝ፡ አውገዝነ፡ ወአሰርነ፡ በማዕሠር፡ ዘኢትፈታሕ፡ ወዘኢያከብር፡በዓላ፡ ለእግዚእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ከመ፡ እሑድ፡ ሰንበት፡ እስከ፡ አመ፡ ይመጽአ፡ወልድ፡ በስብሐ [Fol. 15vb] ት፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን።
desccontent.etranslation: Fol. 15va l.5: And for us, may they be cut off and excommunicated by the sword of our word, of abba Mikaˀel and abba Gäbrəˀel, because we have received their power, and therefore we excommunicated and bind fast, with a fetter which cannot be opened until her Son will come in glory, him, who do not honour the festival of our Lady Mary like the first Sabbath. [Fol. 15vb]  For ever and ever. Amen.
desccontent.details:
The end of the text is missing. S. MS, fol. 15vb, Budge 1900:4 and Täsfa Gäbrä Śəllase 1961:20.
Fol. 10ra-13va, l.8: Mäṣḥafä śərˁat (1st part)
Fol. 13va, l.8-14ra, l.4: Haleluya Haleluya nəsgəd läˀabäbərhanat
Fol. 14ra, l.4-14rb, l.18: Mäṣḥafä śərˁat (2nd part)
Fol. 14va, l.1-14vb, l.17: Sälam to the Apostles
Fol. 15ra, l.1-15vb, l.2: Mäṣḥafä śərˁat (3rd part)

desccontent.incipit: Fol. 16ra: በስመ ፡”...ንነግረክሙ፡ አኃዊነ፡ ፍቁራን፡ ውሉደ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን። እግዚአብሔር፡ ይባርክሙ፡ ወያብርህ፡ አዕይንተ፡ አልባቢክሙ፡ ለሰሚዓ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ቅድስት፡ ወድንግልት፡ በክልኤ፡ ማርያም። ...
desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 16ra:  In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit, one God. We will tell you, our brothers, children of the church, may God bless you and enlighten the eyes of your hearts to hear the miracles of our Lady Mary, the holy and twofold Virgin...
desccontent.explicit: Fol. 17va: ...ቅድመ፡ ሥዕላ፡ ስግዱ ፡ሰዘኢሰገደ፡ ላ[Fol. 17vb]ቲ፡ይደምሰስ፡ እምቅዋሙ። ወኢይትዓወቅ፡ ዝክረ፡ ስሙ። አሜን፡ ይቤሉ፡መላእክተ፡ ሰማይ፡ ኵሎሙ።
desccontent.etranslation: [Fol. 17va, l.19]: ... Prostrate yourself before her image, for the name of the one who did not prostrate himself will be blotted out of existence, and the memorial of his name will not be known. And all the angels of heaven will say: "Amen".

desccontent.text: I-3) ʾƎsäggǝd läki wäʾǝweddǝsäki "I worship Thee…"
desccontent.author: ascribed to John Chrysostom
desccontent.lfurther: The Hymn can be found also as separate text, included in different collections, cp. Or. 13269 (StrBritLib 51, no. 35)

desccontent.incipit: (1st Miracle – About Ildefonsus [Däqəsyos  ] of Toledo [Ṭəlṭəlyaya]) Fol. 20ra: በስመ ፡”... ንጽሕፍ፡ በረድኤተ፡ ሀብቱ፡ በጽሒፈ፡ ተአምራቲሃ፡ ለእግዚእትነ፡ ቅድስት፡ ድንግል፡ በክልኤ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ዘኢይክሉ፡ ፈጽሞ፡ ነጊረ፡ ዕበያ፡ ወክብራ፡ ወውዳሴሃ፡ ኢሰማያውያን፡ወኢምድራውያን፡ ጸሎታ፡ ወበረከታ፡ ወምሕረተ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ገብራ፡ ጽንፈ፡ ዜና፡ ማርያም፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን።
desccontent.explicit: (48th Miracle) Fol. 109ra, l. 7: ወሀለዉ ፡ ውሉደ ፡ ውሉዱ፡ በሩካን፡ አግብርተ፡ እግዚእትነ፡ ቅድስት፡ ድንግል፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ እስከ፡  ዮም፡ ውስተ፡ ይእቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፨ ወአውረስቶ፡ ምሕረተ፡ [Fol. 209rb]  ወልዳ። ጸሎታ፡ ወበረከታ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ገብራ፡ ኪዳነ፡ ማርያም፡ ለዓለመ፡ዓለም፡ አሜን፨
desccontent.details:
I-4)-1. Fols. 20ra-22rb: About Ildefonsus (Däqəsyos) of Toledo (Ṭəlṭəlyaya)
(BMirMA 10-12; BHMirM 1-4; CerMaria 310-316; ColMirM 23-24 //
mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 100, no. 32, I, D.-7; éth. 60, fols. 8-10, ZotBNat 62, n°60-1; Orient. 8814, fols. 98r-100v, StrBritLib 46, no. 32, 16.-1).

(BMirMA 13; BHMirM 310; ColMirM 369 // 
mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, no. 32, I, D.-8; éth. 60, fols. 10v-11, ZotBNat 62, n°60-2).

(BMirMA 13; BHMirM 6-7 //
mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, no. 32, I, D.-9; éth. 60, fols. 11-12, ZotBNat 62, n°60-3; Orient. 8814, fols. 100v-101r, StrBritLib 46, no. 32,16.-2).

mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, no. 32, I, D.-10; éth. 60, fols. 12-13, ZotBNat 62, n°60-4; Orient. 8814, fols. 101r-103v, StrBritLib 46, no. 32, 16.-3).

(BMirMA 15; BHMirM 10-13; ColMirM 512 //
mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, no. 32, I, D.-11; éth. 60, fols. 13-14, ZotBNat 62, n°60-5; Orient. 8814, fols. 103v-104v, StrBritLib 46, no. 32, 16.-4).

(BMirMA 15-16; BHMirM 14-16; CerMaria 436-444 //
mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, no. 32, I, D.-12; éth. 60, fols. 14-15v, ZotBNat 62, n°60-6; Orient. 8814, fols. 104v-106v, StrBritLib 47, no. 32, 16.-5).

(BMirMA 17-18; BHMirM 20-22; ColMirM 265-273 //

(BMirMA 18-19; BHMirM 23-25; CerMaria 191-192 //
mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, no. 32, I, D.-14; éth. 60, fols. 17-18, ZotBNat 62, n°60-8; Orient. 8814, fols. 108v-110v, StrBritLib 47, no. 32, 16.-7).
I-4)-9. Fols. 33rb-35rb: The Virgin Mary and the painter decorating a church in France (hagärä Afransa)
(BMirMA 19-20; BHMirM 26-32 //
mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, no. 32, I, D.-15; éth. 60, fols. 18-19v, ZotBNat 62, n°60-9; Orient. 8814, fols. 110v-112v, StrBritLib 47, no. 32, 16.-8).
I-4)-10. Fols. 35rb-36rb: The Virgin Mary and the sick monk in the ‟Monastery of Pilgers” ( Däbrä Näggadəyan)
(BMirMA 20-21; BHMirM 33-34; CerMaria 192 //
mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, no. 32, I, D.-16; éth. 60, fols. 19v-20v, ZotBNat 63, n°60-10; Orient. 8814, fols. 112v-114r, StrBritLib 47, no. 32, 16.-9).
I-4)-11. Fols. 36va-39ra: The Virgin Mary and the youth Zachary (Zäkaryas)
(BMirMA 21-22; BHMirM 35-37; ColMirM 85-86 //
mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 100, no. 32, I, D.-1; éth. 60, fols. 20v-22v, ZotBNat 63, n°60-11; Orient. 8814, fols. 114r-117v, StrBritLib 47, no. 32, 16.-10).
I-4)-12. Fols. 39rb-40va: The Virgin Mary and the women Juliana and Barbara  of Bethlehem
(BMirMA 23; BHMirM 39-40; CerMaria 520-527 //
mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 100, no. 32, I, D.-2; éth. 60, fols. 22v-23v, ZotBNat 63, n°60-12; Orient. 8814, fols. 117v-119v, StrBritLib 47, no. 32, 16.-11).

(otherwise not attested?).

(ColMirM 176-180// otherwise not attested?).

(ColMirM 107-109// otherwise not attested?).

(otherwise not attested?).
I-4)-46. Fols. 104va-106vb: About the young child called Cosma (Qozmos) of Bartos (probably incomplete)
I-4)-47. Fols. 107ra-108vb: 47th Miracle – About a renegade Christian who saw Virgin Mary in a vision, reconverted and was killed by Muslims (the same as 44th Miracle, above; incomplete, the end missing).
I-4)-48. Fol. 109ra-rb: The end of a miracle (unidentified, incomplete, the beginning missing).

desccontent.text: I-5) ʾAkkonu bǝʾǝsi "Does not the Man..."
desccontent.etranslation: Fol. 77ra l.4: ...Wishing to write the praise of His mother they could not encompass (the miracles) completely, absolutely, one by one, since they are many like sand and their number is unlimited.
desccontent.details: Each of the 33 strophes of the hymn follows a miracles of Mary, I-4) - 34). The last strophe (n°34) of the hymn is missing.

edition.text: S. GRÉBAUT, Les miracles de Jésus, Paris 1919 (PO 12), 583-588.

literature.text: EAE IV, "Täʾmrä Iyäsus"; W. WITAKOWSKI, “The Miracles of Jesus: An Ethiopian Apocryphal Gospel”, Apocrypha 6, 1995, 279-298.

desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 6ra, l.11: When arrived the time of the birth of Our Lord and Our Savior Jesus Christ, a decree was proclaimed by the King that all children of Israel be counted in their respective country.
desccontent.details: As the selection of miracles and the passages of the ˀAkkonu bəˀəsi indicates, the initial intention of the scribe (or creator of the archetype) was to produce a compilation of two works: the Täˀamrä Maryam wä-Iyäsus (cp. Witakowski 1995:281, cp. Uppsala O Etiop 15). However, it was dropped already in the beginning of the work; apart from the strophes of the hymn, only 3 miracles of Jesus were included, two in the beginning and one in the end.

additional.cont: Fols. 1ra-2ra: Excerpt from Śərˁatä mənkwəsənna "The Order of the Monastic Profession".
additional.det: Written on a bifolio originating from a different Ms., added to the Ms. as endleaf.

additional.cont: Fol. 9ra-rb: A miracle of Mary, incomplete.
additional.det: The miracle is crudely written in pen.

additional.cont: Fol. 19ra-rb: Hymns to St. Mary.
additional.add:
-  ˀO-ˀәgzǝˀtǝyä qəddəst dəngəl bä-kəlˀe Maryam wäladitä ˀamlak... "O my Holy Lady Mary, Two-fold Virgin, Godbearing..." (fol. 19ra-rb)

- ˀO-ˀәgzǝˀtǝyä qəddəst dəngəl bä-kəlˀe Maryam Mariham ˀəmmu lä-ˀIyäsus Krǝstos kähali... "O my Lady, Holy Two-fold Virgin Mary, Mother of Jesus Christ, the Almighty..." (fol. 19rb-va)(cp. ChRep no. 373)

- Sälam läki ˀo-ˀәgzǝˀtǝyä qəddəst dəngəl Maryam ˀəmmä bərhan[sic] wä-ˀəmmä bərhan... "Salutation to you, o my Lady, Holy Virgin Mary, Mother [of the Saviour] and Mother of the Light..." (fol. 19va-vb).
additional.det: The hymns were probably written in hand b.
Written on an endleaf (probably added later).

additional.add: Fol. 111ra: ዝ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘወሀባ፡ ለማርያም፡ አሲር፡ መትራ፡ የሻለ፡ ቃ፡ ኪዳነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወለ፡ አቡሀ፡ ቲሰፋ፡ ማርያም፡ ወለእሙ፡ ወለተ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ወለብዕሲቱ፡ ወለተ፡ ሥላሲ፡ ዘኦጥረ፡ ዮ፡ በንዋዮ፡ ዘሰረቆ፡ ወዘፈሐቆ፡ በስልጣነ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ይኩን።
additional.det: Partly illegible. The note states Täsfa Maryam as buyer and donater of the Ms.

additional.cont: Fol. 111v: Magic prayer against snake venom.

extras.extra: - Crude drawings: fol. 112r-v. - Pen trial: fol. 112r

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Undecorated quire marks are written in the left upper corner on fols.: 28r: ፪; 36r: ፫; 44r: ፬; 52r: ፭; 60r: ፮; 67r: ፯.

miniature.details: Possibly conceived as "Enthroned Virgin with Child", but unfinished or executed in the wrong way (?).

frames.frame: Fol. 10r (incipit page of Text I-1b): crude ornamental band; geometric and floral motifs (in red and blue pen).
